text: South Luzon or Southern Luzon is a sub-super region of Luzon in the Philippines, comprising of three regions: the Calabarzon, Mimaropa and Bicol Region. These include the metropolitan areas of Metro Batangas, Metro Lucena, Urban Laguna and Metro Naga, outside of Metro Manila (NCR) are predominantly Tagalog people and Bicolano people, speakers of the Tagalog language and Bikol languages.https://www.touropia.com/southern-luzon-philippines ==Geography== Calamba City is the most densly in terms of income and has a lot of numerous industrial zone in Southern Luzon, situated at the vicinity outside of Metro Manila. ===Regions=== Region Regional center Population (2015) Basin Bicol Region Legazpi 5,796,989 Visayan Sea Calabarzon Calamba 14,414,774
